oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Atlas of the city of Nashville 1908. [Plate 12A]
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 1 map; 58 x 75 cm. A plat map of downtown Nashville, Tennessee, originally published in 1908 by G. M. Hopkins Company, showing the various buildings, landscapes, acreage, and street routes for several blocks. Original building structures are depicted on the map, such as Elliot School, North Nashville Baptist Church Tennessee Academy of Music, Church of the Assumption and School, Monroe Street Methodist Episcopal Church, Warioto Cotton Mills, German Methodist Episcopal Church, and portions of the Louisville and Nashville Railroad. This plat map is reproduced from the source: Atlas of the city of Nashville, Tennessee : from official records, private plans and actual surveys, G. M. Hopkins, [Philadelphia, Pa.] 1908. Scale 150 feet to an inch. The original dimensions of the map, in the atlas publication: 15 1/2 x 22 3/4 in. (i.e. 58 x 75 cm.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Elliott School (Nashville, Tenn.); North Nashville Baptist Church (Tenn.); Tennessee Academy of Music; Church of the Assumption of the Blessed Virgin Mary (Nashville, Tenn.); Monroe Street Methodist Episcopal Church (Nashville, Tenn.); Warioto Cotton Mills (Nashville, Tenn.); German Methodist Episcopal Church (Nashville, Tenn.); Louisville and Nashville Railroad Company; Morgan Hamilton Company (Nashville, Tenn.)
